intro: Galearis paxiana, commonly known as the pale paxia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. Galearis paxiana is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
